bow: my whole day got ruined really like to vent and get some perspective well guess this is as good time as any for an intro am 23 and have an 18 month old son my husband is currently deployed so here all day every day by myself my parenting style is love whenever can but not to coddle will let my son cry it out but only to certain extent and this is where it all begins think made mistake by posting what happened as status on facebook the base we are at is very little town and lot of the spouses find that their hobby is to talk shit sorry for language and start drama anyways what happened was last night put my son down for bed pretty late because did get out of the gym until pretty late in the middle of the night he woke up and started whimpering usually he does this if he has bad dream or wakes up without the pacifier in his mouth since am trying to get rid of the pacifier decided to let him cry it out eventually he will go back to sleep right so hopped in the shower and ended up taking really long one really felt like needed it when got out of the shower he was still crying since knew that was out of character for him went to check on him and give him love am guessing he woke up did know where he was and accidentally fell out of his bed when opened his door he was crying because he fell out of the bed he was crying because he was trying to get back into his bed and it was too tall for him to climb he got shiner on his forehead from where he fell but it only took 10 minutes of snuggling in the rocking chair for him to fall asleep again so posted status on fb about how felt bad that he hit his head my poor baby but he ok blah blah blah then get an angry message waking me up from my husband he whole other story if you want to know suppose could divulge but it rather lengthy saying why the fuck did you check on him are you really that dumb you re the worst mother ever ca believe you let him cry like that that abuse calling cps when tried to explain myself he would not listen he kept saying what if he broke his arm blah blah blah and he would not accept my reasoning that know which cry is which and he was clearly whimpering when got in the shower not crying in pain know the difference his retort was whatever you re dumb do talk to me so he started ignoring me and did even respond to my suggestion that we skype so that he could see with his own eyes that his son was perfectly fine so it ruined my whole day ve been fighting back tears and trying not to feel horrible already feel bad that let him cry for so long but now being called an abuser and was even given the chance to defend or explain myself either did do anything wrong mean if seriously did do something wrong then please tell me not perfect and would want to know if can be better mom it really hurts me that people would go gossiping behind my back and that gossip could reach my husband who is thousands of miles away deleted the status on fb made another status asking people to come to me if they have problem and cleaned out my friends list of anyone who think would start drama also changed my privacy settings so that only certain people can see my posts and will be more careful of what post if something so little can be taken out of context and blown up to this do even want to have facebook account anymore if you ve been through this could sure use your help whether your words are kind or harsh does not matter just need perspective this bedroom set up sounds bit dangerous to me your son can fall far enough to get shiner maybe you could put him in crib or crib mattress on the floor instead of bed before you tell me he can climb out of crib ll tell you mine can too they re 5yo and we put them in sleep sacks zipped up in the back so they ca lift their legs high enough to get foot over the rail that solution has been working well for us for the last year plan to keep them in cribs as long as possible as to the drama well your husband reaction suggests that he emotionally abusive might be time for some marriage counseling most concerned about how your husband treated you that was completely unacceptable kids fall out of beds it happens you should look into ensuring he ca easily fall out again mattress on the floor or better guard rails may be necessary but hey lesson learned and you are right by 18 months we have certainly learned to distinguish between whimpers and true distress trust you that you did hear distress or pain in his cries you did deserve to be belittled and called bad mom for that sorry you had to put up with that we all make mistakes like this we learn from them it makes us slightly better parents each time and we move on kids fall and get hurt it kind of fact of life in my opinion you should have checked before getting into the shower but you said he was only whimpering like he was going to go back to sleep your husband sounds immature but you never know what he was actually told when he called he may have been told by another person that you let the baby fall and sit there crying or something else that totally got blown out of proportion he does have an extremely stressful job and hearing that shit going down at home could have set him off that does excuse his behavior but when he not there he may not get the full story say try to monitor what you write on facebook especially if you have local busybodies on your page who insist on spreading gossip and hatred you should get one of those swing down bed rails they have them most stores that carry baby stuff and if money is an issue go to consignment shop do excuse my language but shit happens and it probably going to happen again ignore the ass holes that gossip since they ve probably done worst and do what you know is right for your child you did do anything wrong and you re not abusive if anything it is your husband who is verbally abusing you do know what it is about facebook that seems to bring out the drama whores in people you think those moms would understand that kids get bumps on the head sometimes some people just have nothing better to do than try and run other people lives and threaten cps on them agree that there might be issues with op sleep setup but yours sounds little excessive most kids are more than able to handle toddler bed by and honestly shocked that anyone even makes sleep sack big enough for two year old by that age my kid had been in toddler bed with guard rail for several months and was getting up on her own to use the potty during the night one time thought my daughter was just sleeping late so around 10 in the morning finally decided to check on her found her crying very quietly completely soaked in urine forgot to put bed time pull up on her and she said she was to scared to come tell me apparently when told her to stay in bed meaning stop coming out asking for things to avoid going to bed she took it literally felt so bad she slept in piss all night these things happen do beat yourself up over it but if my husband ever talked to me the way yours does he find himself single very quickly there no reason for it who threatens to call cps on their own wife ve not been through anything like this as my son is only months old disclaimers aside here how personally feel about what you wrote even though he was only whimpering when you started your shower feel like since your son was awake you should not have been doing something that you could hear him falling and or crying that just my personal feeling and maybe 15 months from now ll feel different do know do feel like have to have eyes on my son if he safely in his crib but do feel like if know he awake should be able to hear him if need to take shower ll turn on the baby monitor and take it in there with me agree once they get past certain age it okay to let them cry it out but do think it was acceptable for your son to injure himself to the point of having shiner and you to be unaware of it sorry if this sounds mean but think you should reevaluate your priorities from everything know about the cry it out method it does not mean go somewhere or do something where you can not hear your kid crying for an extended period of time that said do think your husband reacted well and should have threatened to call cps he probably should have told you his feelings calmly and asked you to do things differently in the future so long story short if you were me would no longer be out of earshot of my son when knew he was awake would probably lower the crib mattress if it not already to its lowest position and or set up different sleeping arrangement and would talk to my husband about parenting styles and expectations and what my intent was vs what actually happened agree with this 500 there is definitely difference between the woke up cries the frustrated cries and the pain cries and by now she would know the difference sounds like the husband overreacted but that nothing gives him an excuse to say what he said he an adult and should discuss his problems like an adult she already has one toddler to handle alone and does need petulant husband telling her she bad mother around that age my first kid woke up in the middle of the night cried for little bit and then seemed to fall back to sleep crying in the middle of the night was bit out of character but we did use cio since he fell back to sleep thought all was fine when he woke up in the morning he clearly been sleeping in puddle of his own vomit and that probably why he cried out hello guilt city so yep been there did you do something wrong my opinion should matter at all to you truly would you do things differently if you heard him crying again tonight do think getting in the shower while your kid cries it out is good idea to be honest as you pointed out you know your little one cries but if you ca hear him then it does really matter how well you know his cries there are lot of resources for military couples it definitely sounds like he is not being reasonable and not listening to you the most important source this is facebook fault or even the fault of anyone who passed the information on to him it sounds like he has some growing and learning to do about maintaining healthy marriage would seriously consider seeking out those resources gt but if my husband ever talked to me the way yours does he find himself single very quickly there no reason for it in the words of the great homey clown homey do play that honestly if it were me probably would ve checked on my son before getting into the shower or would ve taken monitor in there with me just so that was able to fully relax and not worry it does sound as though it time to either convert his crib or get him into toddler bed with guard rail fortunately with my son he never fell out of the crib before we converted his bed but we saw him climbing over it few times and knew it was time now will say that am terrified of putting together furniture was single mom for years before getting married so feel like can say in my most empowered voice that tasks like converting toddler bed are something that need my husband to do digress but my point is that if you re anything like me in that regard understand why he still in crib presumably moving on saw one other person on here comment that your husband has stressful job and you never know what will set him off blah blah blah there certainly validity to that and can appreciate his service but the choice to join the armed forces was at least on some level choice he made and he does get to take his stress out on you especially without listening to your side of the story first the way he treated you was unacceptable something to remember about deployments your husband may be feeling powerless from afar and thus may be more prone to lashing out at nothing again this behavior is not acceptable but it might to some degree help explain why he reacted so strongly but like said he needs to listen and come to you first before he jumps to conclusions if you re in the us there are number of programs available to military couples to help in times of high stress there are also lots of support groups available if you like more information on any of these please feel free to message me sorry that it ruined your day would like to mention as social worker who knows bit about child welfare dhs is not going to take your son away or judge you or do anything else to inhibit your ability and right to mother your son if your husband did call and file report the most they re going to do is come and check out your house and find that it was an unsubstantiated claim and move on mom guilt sucks and so does marital tension but it does seem as though you have legitimate reason to feel badly and it sounds as though you truly have your son well being at the forefront of your mind just keep doing what you re doing and everything will work out as for the facebook bit understand the gossipy culture of military bases and my best advice would be to not get sucked into it it sounds as though you re trying to avoid it but even removing potential drama queens from your facebook might be enough to stir up some trouble maybe you could just be especially cognizant of how people might interpret what you post know it bummer to censor but unfortunately it necessary evil for most of us how long has your husband been deployed it sounds like he has got realistic idea of what it like to be parent of an 18 month old alone mistakes happen and this was pretty innocent one you should probably be around to supervise the kid when he awake but think your greatest mistake was the fb overshare understand you may be lonely and looking to commiserate but posting the personal details of your day to day life and motherhood on fb is not the answer maybe your husband lashed out because he feels left out and out of control being so far away that or he an immature jerk or maybe both this is not the behavior of loving husband who respects his wife your parenting is fine your husband behavior is not if this is typical behavior for him then personally would run not walk to file for divorce relationship without mutual respect is not worth it know it took me ten years to figure it out but now ve been in an amazing respectful relationship for 12 years the difference is like night and day though it much easier to see that in retrospect hmm so personally think might have checked on my little one before taking shower and usually have my baby monitor with me even if she asleep but my family has told me numerous times that over attentive and anxious and all that the thing is we all make mistakes and us mothers are *always learning* why just today had my baby out for nursing when was in town and when got home realized had strapped her back into her car seat felt horrible and imagined all the things that could have happened but she safe and sound and now going to double check each time hope your husband changes his tune when he gets back my boyfriend has said few harsh things over the phone but when he gets elbow deep in parenting he told me how awesome mother am oh and pro tip if your little guy keeps falling out of bed get one of those pool noodles and put it beneath the mattress cover on the side of the bed you are not bad mother kids get hurt for example 20 odd years ago my cousin fell off small wall and broke her arm nobody realised until the next day when it had swollen up two years ago friends little boy climbed out of his crib and fell nobody noticed anything was wrong until months later when he fell second time at daycare and was taken for an ray only to be told he had healed fracture plus the new one your husband should not have spoken to you like that but people do stupid stuff when they are worried and can imagine it not easy hearing your child is hurt when you are far away if that is the case have word about his reaction when he has calmed down but if he is truly douche you need to look at your relationship because you do deserve to be treated like that and are you going to be cutting up their food until they re 16 kids fall shit happens how on earth are you going to potty train if you plan on keeping them in cribs for as long as possible and the only solution to this is sleep sack zipped up in the back the face is incredibly vascular meaning it bruises easier than other parts of the body kids do need to be in crib that long toddler bed with decent sized rail is perfectly fine while admit the sleep sacks are clever and may be good idea for baby like year old or younger that climbs do think forcing toddler in sleep sack is normal behavior the only ones ve seen only go up to month size my year old has bed and comes to my door when he has to potty ca imagine confining him at that age he is like little person now not just baby that ca communicate or understand properly you are abusing your son your husband is abusing you he not there and did know what goes on he does have the right to call you bad mother over status he is there every night and go through what you do ve done what you did plenty of times if know it certain cry that can be ignored then will and all is well dare your husband to step in your shoes for week he would change his attitude real fast sorry you had to deal with this it not your fault and you re not bad mom because of it year olds in sleep sacks that bit much ny now they should be in toddler bed and fully able to get in and out by themselves with no problem babies use sleepsacks not toddlers deleted deleted deleted deleted deleted deleted deleted deleted deleted speaking of money you might also consider video monitor they can be pricy but especially if you are doing cry it out it can be really helpful for me at least to get glimpse of what going on know having the video monitor gives me peace of mind when in the shower doing laundry etc definitely you ca fault yourself that it happened just make sure to make the proper adjustments now that you know he can roll out my hat off to you ca imagine how stressful it must be to parent alone while your husband is deployed hang in
